articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Work in Various Fields in Counties
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Work in Various Fields in Counties
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the work in various fields in Kyongsong and Myongchon Counties.
					He went round the Kyongsong Revolutionary Museum and the Yombunjin Revolutionary Site associated with immortal revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Saying that the education through revolutionary sites is of weighty importance in arming the members of the WPK and other working people with its revolutionary idea, he indicated tasks and ways to do so.
					
					Then he provided field guidance to the Kyongsong Insulator Factory.
					
					He visited the monuments to the on-the-spot instructions and field guidance given by the President before making rounds of different places including Insulator Shop No. 2 to learn in detail about technical updating and production there. 
					
					 He provided field guidance to the Kim Jong Suk Sanatorium.
					
					 After being briefed on hot-spring in Kyongsong, he looked round the interior of the sanatorium to acquaint himself in detail with its medical facilities and treatment.
					
					 Hot-spring in Kyongsong is good for the treatment of diverse diseases as it contains highly efficacious medical substance, he said, underscoring the need to spruce up the sanatorium and improve its management and operation so as that the Korean people may fully benefit from free medical care.
					
					 Then, he looked round dwelling houses newly built by the county around the sanatorium. He visited the family of ex-officer Ju Kwang Su who works as doctor at the sanatorium to give a warm pep talk to him and his family.
					
					 He went round the Mt. Chilbo Recreation Ground.
					
					 He covered a long tourist course of inner, outer and sea Chilbo to acquaint himself in detail with the construction of the recreation ground.
					
					 Underlining the need to provide ample conditions for an increasing number of visitors to fully enjoy the spectacular scenery of Mt. Chilbo and have pleasant recreation, he specified orientation and ways to do so.
					
					 He visited the newly built Hwangjin hot-spring village.
					
					 Making rounds of the general public service centre equipped with all public service facilities and the family of Won Ki Chol, a farmer, he wished the farmers living in the modern houses a happy future.
					
					 Saying that it is necessary to let people make a wide use of hot-spring in Hwangjin as it is one very good for people's health, he set forth tasks to be fulfilled to do so.
					
					 The world-startling miracles and signal achievements are now being reported from every place of the country and its wealth is on the daily increase at present when the march of the revolution is resounding forth loudly, he noted, adding that these great changes unprecedented in history are the precious fruition of the inexhaustible mental power and noble patriotism which inspired the Korean people to display the "do-or-die" spirit to build a great prosperous and powerful nation by their own efforts without fail.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the working people in Kyongsong and Myongchon Counties would continue creditably playing a vanguard role in the gigantic drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hong Sok Hyong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and other leading officials of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Tomb of Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Tomb of Kim Po Hyon
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the tomb of Kim Po Hyon, an ardent patriot, in Mangyongdae on Wednesday on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of his demise.
					Seen standing before his tomb was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, ministries, national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and working people here.
					
					Wreaths were laid before the tomb in the name of the C. C., the WPK, ministries, national institutions, revolutionary schools, education and media organs and party and power organs and farms in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					The participants observed a moment's silence in the memory of his noble life.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a congratulatory letter by the Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps in the DPRK on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					They were handed to an official concerned on Wednesday.

articles.title: Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Industrial Establishment
articles.content:
Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Industrial Establishment 
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps here visited the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory Wednesday in the run-up to the 61st anniversary of the founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The guests first moved to the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the factory where they were briefed on the fact that it has turned into the nation's reliable electric wire-producing centre under the wise leadership of the party and the leader.
					
					Going round several places of the factory, they were impressed to see its workers busy with a high-pitched drive for successfully concluding the 150-day campaign.

articles.title: 10th Anniversary of IMAGC Observed
articles.content:
10th Anniversary of IMAGC Observed
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting to mark the 10th anniversary of the founding of the International Martial Arts Games Committee (IMAGC) took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Wednesday.
					Present there were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Chang Ung, chairman of the IMAGC who doubles as president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the federation and secretary general of the committee, members of the executive committee, delegates of various countries and regions and officials concerned.
					
					Kwak in his congratulatory address at the meeting expressed belief that this event would mark an opportunity of deepening the friendship among the world martial arts players, boosting the ties of solidarity and cooperation among them and developing the IMAGC.
					
					Chang Ung in his report at the meeting referred to the successes made by the IMAGC since its founding and tasks to be fulfilled by it in the days ahead. 
					
					Then the floor was taken by Leong Wai Meng, Fritz Wendland, founding president of the WKC, Khor Eng Chor, president of the Australian Martial Art Games Committee, and Marek Atilla Janecek, senior vice-president of the WMF.
					
					A letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.
					
					The letter noted that the achievements made by the IMAGC over the last decade would be unthinkable without the particular care of Kim Jong Il and the positive assistance of the government of the DPRK.
					
					The martial arts players of various countries will extend firm support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause of achieving Korea's reunification and building a thriving nation, it stressed.

articles.title: Demonstration Performances Given
articles.content:
Demonstration Performances Given
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Demonstration performances were given by the Korean Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group and martial arts players of various countries at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Wednesday to mark the 10th anniversary of the International Martial Arts Games Committee.
					Among the spectators were Chang Ung, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation who is chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the federation who is secretary general of the committee, members of the executive committee, delegates of various countries and regions, Hwang Pong Yong, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who is also chairman of the Korean Martial Arts Federation, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					The demonstration group demonstrated the progress of Taekwon-Do, the orthodox martial arts of the nation, in the games including pattern, sparring, self-defense and special technique events.
					
					The demonstration performances given by the martial arts players of the DPRK, Germany and Australia were acclaimed by the spectators for presenting peculiar technical movements of various national martial arts.

articles.title: National Martial Arts Championship Opens
articles.content:
National Martial Arts Championship Opens
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The 4th National Martial Arts Championship for September 10 Prize opened with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall Wednesday.
					Players from provincial Taekwon-Do teams and more than 10 units including the Sunchon Cement Complex Taekwon-Do team will compete in events of Taekwon-Do, paduk and Korean wrestling. 
					
					Present at the ceremony were Minister of Urban Management Hwang Hak Won, chairman of the Taekwon-Do Association of the DPRK, and officials concerned, players and youth and students.
					
					Hwang Pong Yong, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, addressed the ceremony.

articles.title: Vietnamese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Vietnamese Ambassador Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Le Van Cu, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, Tuesday hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on the national day of Vietnam.
					Present there on invitation were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 On hand were staff members of the Vietnamese embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Quail Dish, New Menu of Okryu Restaurant
articles.content:
Quail Dish, New Menu of Okryu Restaurant
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Okryu Restaurant on the bank of the River Taedong flowing through Pyongyang serves quail dishes from September 1.
					The dishes are served at room No. 2 of the main building.
					
					Available there are not only roasted quail, fried quail, steamed quail stuffed with glutinous rice and quail wonton but also famous Pyongyang cold noodle, mung-bean pancake and others.
					
					The quail meat contains protein, fat, carbohydrate, calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, iron, sodium and others.
					
					The quail egg is richer in nutritive elements than the other poultry eggs. It is efficacious for the treatment of diseases such as hypertension and puerperalism.
					
					Chief Engineer Ra Suk Gyong told KCNA that the restaurant serves quail dishes under the popular policy of the government, adding:
					
					The restaurant, which has been famous with Pyongyang cold noodle, gives greater pleasure to the customers with tasty and nutritious quail dishes.
					
					We will further deepen the study of quail cooking methods and increase its assortments in order to serve people more quail dishes.

articles.title: Natural Tetrodocain Injection
articles.content:
Natural Tetrodocain Injection
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- The Tetrodocain Injection produced by the Korea Jangsaeng J.V. Company enjoys great public favor for its mysterious medicinal effect.
					Tetrodocain (tetrodotoxin), main ingredient of the injection, is natural toxin separated from puffer.
					
					It, with good anesthetic effect, is used for the alleviation of pains including pain of terminal cancers, neuralgia and rheumatic arthritis and for the treatment of geriatric diseases.
					
					The injection, which is efficacious for treating various cancers, is recognized as a highly potent antiviral substance. 
					
					In particular, it proved efficacious for treating narcotic addicts in some countries and its therapeutic effect is noticeable in curing tuberculosis.
					
					The injection whose medicinal value has been proved in many years of clinical tests is winning popularity in the world.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Preserve Their National Self-Esteem
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Preserve Their National Self-Esteem
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- A people strong in national self-esteem can defend the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and achieve the prosperity and development of the country and the nation while meeting any challenge. This is the truth taught by history.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					National self-esteem serves as a powerful weapon for every country and nation to protect themselves and achieve prosperity.
					
					There is nothing impossible if one is confident that one's nation is not inferior to other nation and one has the determination to defend and demonstrate the dignity of the nation to the last and the faith and will to dedicate oneself to one's nation.
					
					In the new century some countries allowed themselves to be reduced to a scene of genocide after being derived of their sovereignty, exposed to military strikes of imperialists, mainly because they lacked national self-esteem.
					
					The Korean people have covered the most arduous and thorny path which no country has ever done. 
					
					On this path they stood in fierce military and political confrontation with the imperialists, experienced bitter adversities and underwent economic difficulties and hardships in living caused by repeated natural disasters.
					
					Possessed of strong national self-esteem, the Korean people could foil the high-handed policy of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK with the toughest measures. 
					
					All the miraculous successes achieved by the Korean people this year are the brilliant fruition of the strong national self-esteem peculiar to them.
					
					The stirring reality in which great leaping advances and changes are taking place everywhere clearly testifies to the fact that the national self-esteem of the Korean people serves, indeed, as strong mental power to create everything from scratch and a powerful weapon for frustrating any pressure and sanctions of  the imperialists.

articles.title: Russia Takes Countermeasure against U.S. and Japan's Missile Shields
articles.content:
Russia Takes Countermeasure against U.S. and Japan's Missile Shields
 Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Makarov, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, when interviewed on Aug. 26, announced that Russia deployed one battalion of S-400 Triumf air defence systems in the Far Eastern region to be ready to go into action. 
					 Commenting on it, public opinion viewed the action as a countermeasure taken by Russia to cope with the U.S. and Japan's daily intensified arms buildup. 
					
					 Russia's Internet newspaper Ekspert Online put it that Russia's building of missile and air defence systems in the Far East is aimed to cope with the U.S. missile defence system (MD) in the Asia-Pacific and interceptor missile system in Japan.
					
					 The first vice-director of the Institute for Geopolitical Studies of Russia said that Russia is building in the Far Eastern region a system equivalent to the U.S. missile and air defence systems gaining in scope from its eastern line, adding that Russia is interested in coping with the threat posed by the U.S. which provoked several illegal wars over the past decade.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in France, a reading session in Guinea and a film show took place in South Africa from Aug. 18 to 24 on the occasion of the 61st birthday of the DPRK.
					Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said at the seminar that the more than six decade-long history of the DPRK is a glorious history in which it demonstrated the invincibility of the socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, to the whole world under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, at the reading session titled "The DPRK Winning Victory Thanks to Songun" noted that the history of the DPRK proves that the dignity and honor of the nation are guaranteed by Songun.
					
					The chairperson of the Mahlambandlophy, Pretoria City, Branch of the African National Congress of South Africa, after watching a Korean film dealing with the feats performed by the peerlessly great persons, expressed the conviction that the Korean people are sure to triumph in their drive to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar held in France.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Exploits Lauded
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting, a book exhibition, a briefing on the greatness of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and film shows took place in Pakistan, Denmark and Indonesia between Aug. 20 and 24 to mark the 49th anniversary of his start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					Displayed in the venues of the functions were photos on the immortal Songun revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il and publications introducing the great vitality of the Songun politics.
					
					Fakar Uddin Chaudhry, chairman of the Pakistan Society for the Study of Independence, in his speech made at the meeting said that Kim Jong Il held higher the banner of the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung at the end of the last century when the imperialist forces got more desperate in their moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					He stressed that today the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a socialist power with strong political and military potentials and as an invulnerable fortress in the struggle for independence against imperialism which nobody can attack.
					
					S. M. Masud, lawyer of the Supreme Court of Pakistan who is former minister of Justice, in his speech made at the meeting said that today the President's Songun idea not only has been confidently carried forward by Kim Jong Il but has been steadily developed in depth by him. He added that
						Kim Jong Il has wisely led the Korean people's struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and build a great prosperous and powerful nation with the might of Songun.
					
					Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said at the book exhibition that the Korean people would successfully build a thriving socialist nation while overcoming all sorts of difficulties under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, reiterating the full support and solidarity of the association with the Korean people in their efforts to protect peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					The participants of the film shows watched "The Arms of Korea", "Reply of Korea" and other Korean films.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Mexico
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in booklet by the Workers' Party of Mexico Publishing House on August 25.
					The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies the idea that the 60-year long history of the DPRK is a history of great struggle and victory and that of great creation and change during which the Korean people protected the independence and honor of the country and built a socialist country, powerful and prosperous, despite the tempest of the revolution under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and the great Workers' Party of Korea. It also emphasizes that a country, though small and backward, can become a developed country, dignified and strong country when it has a great leader and great party.
					
					 It indicates the tasks and ways for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, holding high the banner of the Juche idea, the banner of Songun.

articles.title: Memorial Services for Slain Koreans Held in Japan
articles.content:
Memorial Services for Slain Koreans Held in Japan
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Memorial services for the slain Koreans were held in different parts of Japan, according to Choson Sinbo, the organ of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					A meeting for honoring the memory of the Koreans killed in the explosion of "Ukishima-Maru" perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists was held in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture on Aug. 24.
					
					Present there were officials of the Kyoto Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon, Koreans from all walks of life, the mayor of Maizuru City, members of local autonomous bodies of Japan, activists for probing the truth about the forcible drafting of Koreans and others.
					
					Ji Sung Il, vice-chairman of the Santan Chapter of Chongryon, in a memorial address said that the Japanese imperialists deliberately exploded "Ukishima-Maru" in waters off Maizuru Port, Kyoto Prefecture, 64 years ago, killing thousands of Koreans.
					
					The Japanese authorities, however, have not yet made any reparation or official apology to the victims of the thrice-cursed massacre but gone the lengths of turning down the demand for the probe about the truth, he declared. 
					
					Introduced at the meeting was a memorial article written by Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee who is the head of the Central Headquarters of the Koreans' Side of the Fact-Finding Group for the Probe into the Truth about the Forcible Drafting of Koreans. Then Katsuhiko Yoe, chairperson of the Society for the Memory of the Victims of the Explosion of "Ukishima-Maru", made a memorial address.
					
					A memorial meeting for the slain Koreans was also held at Utenji Temple in Tokyo on the same day with the attendance of Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens.
					
					Their remains have not yet been sent to their hometowns due to the obstructions of the Japanese authorities though more than 60 years have passed, the participants deplored, urging the authorities to return the remains to their bereaved families at an early date.

articles.title: Whistle for Nation-Building
articles.content:
Whistle for Nation-Building
Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, visited the Chongjin Iron Works which is now Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex on a day of December Juche 34 (1945).
					She headed for the sheet metal processing shop, seeing with bitter heart the compound of the works destroyed by the Japanese imperialists. Then she stopped by a locomotive belching forth steam.
					
					She exchanged greetings with two young men working with great enthusiasm there and asked if they had ever driven a locomotive.
					
					One of them said that before the liberation of the country he had worked as an assistant engineer but the Japanese engineer had never allowed him even to touch mechanism far from teaching how to drive. He proudly spoke that, unable to repress the then indignation, he, together with friends, had adjusted the locomotive from some days ago and made a fire in the locomotive that morning. 
					
					Listening to him with great satisfaction, she stated that they were the true masters of new Korea and it was no problem to rehabilitate the iron works because there were comrades like them.
					
					She got on the locomotive after him and let him whistle.
					
					The whistle rang throughout the works.
					
					The elevated man began to run the locomotive. People rushed there from far and near.
					
					Seeing the crowd full of emotion, she took the whistle handle to make a whistle once again.
					
					At last she got off the locomotive and said with emphasis that the whistle heralded the start of the rehabilitation of the works.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita comandancia de Unidad Combinada No.264 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita comandancia de Unidad Combinada No.264 del EPC
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito la Comandancia de la Gran Unidad Combinada No. 264 del EPC y presencio con los oficiales y soldados de ella la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito.
					Tras averiguar como esta unidad cumple su mision,  se mostro muy contento de que los oficiales y soldados de aqui incrementaran por todos los medios la combatividad intensificando los ejercicios militares en acato a la orientacion correspondiente del PTC y cumplieran con responsabilidad y alta vigilancia la mision de guardia avanzada.
					
					Evaluo altamente los exitos de los militares de la unidad y se fotografio con ellos.
					
					Acto seguido, el Comandante Supremo presencio en la Casa de los Militares la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito junto con los oficiales y soldados de la unidad y sus familiares.
					
					En la escena se presentaron los coros masculinos "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il", "Trotes en el Paektu", "Seremos decenas de millones de balas y bombas", el solo y coro masculinos "Por la unica patria", el coro "Un soldado con oidos a las espigas de arroz que se agitan", etc.
					
					A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patetico las inmortales hazanas de direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il realizadas bajo la bandera del Songun (priorizacion militar) para el desarrollo de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias y la construccion de una patria prospera y describieron bien la firme conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Al termino de la funcion, el Comandante Supremo reciproco cordialmente el saludo de los espectadores, que le aclamaban hospitalariamente.
					
					Le acompanaron los generales de ejercito del EPC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, y otros comandantes del EPC, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y otros cuadros directivos del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kang Sun Hui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kang Sun Hui
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia primero una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de la difunta Kang Sun Hui, miembro suplente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y subdirectora de la Exhibicion Central de las Muestras de Articulos de Industria Ligera, expresando condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Po Hyon por aniversario 54 de su fallecimiento
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Po Hyon por aniversario 54 de su fallecimiento
Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 54o aniversario del fallecimiento del ferviente patriota Kim Po Hyon, tuvo lugar el dia 2 una ceremonia de homenaje ante su tumba en Mangyongdae.
					Estaba colocada alli una ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En el acto estuvieron presentes Choe Thae Bok, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, ministerios y organos centrales, oficiales y soldados del EPC, asi como trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Se depositaron las ofrendas florales a nombre del CC del PTC, ministerios, organos centrales, escuela revolucionaria, organismos de educacion y de prensa, instituciones del partido y el Poder y granjas en esta capital.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio recordando la noble vida de Kim Po Hyon.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun llama a poseer la dignidad nacional
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun llama a poseer la dignidad nacional
 Pyongyang, 2 de septiembre (ATCC) -- La historia ensena la verdad de que un pueblo con alta dignidad nacional puede defender la soberania y la dignidad de la nacion frustrando cualquier desafio y lograr la prosperidad y el desarrollo del pais y la nacion.
					 Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual del dia 2 y continua:
					
					 La dignidad nacional deviene el arma poderosa de cada pais y cada nacion para defenderse y lograr la prosperidad.
					
					 No habra nada imposible si tiene el credo de que nuestra nacion no es inferior a las otras, la disposicion de defender consecuentemente y glorificar la dignidad nacional, la conviccion y la voluntad de dedicar lo todo a nuestra nacion.
					
					  En el nuevo siglo, por la falta de dignidad nacional, algunos paises han sido victimas de ataque militar de los imperialistas y se han privado de la soberania convirtiendose en el bano de sangre.
					
					  El pueblo coreano recorrio el camino tan arduo y penoso, que nunca ha atravesado ningun otro pais.
					
					  En ese trayecto, hubo la enconada confrontacion  militar y politica con los imperialistas, el maximo duelo nacional y las dificultades economicas y de la vida debido a los repetidos desastres naturales.
					
					  Pero,  partiendo de su fuerte dignidad nacional, el pueblo coreano pudo destruir con sobredureza la politica intransigente de los imperialistas para aplastar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  Este ano, el logro exitos prodigiosos que devienen tambien el resultado de la alta dignidad nacional que le caracteriza.
					
					  La conmovedora realidad de hoy, en que se logran grandes saltos y cambios en todas partes, muestra claramente que la dignidad nacional del pueblo coreano deviene la gran potencia espiritual que permite crear de la nada y el arma potente que frustra cualquier campana de presion y sancion de los imperialistas.
